text: hi I'm Michael Brown I'm the VP of
Technology at Avec networks our
company's been around for about 10 years
and since the very beginning we've been
Cloud native so we've always built our
services in AWS that really helped
accelerate our business in the early
days as we didn't have to develop
in-house expertise for hosting and
devops right away now that we've grown
it's really helped us with Geographic
expansion into new regions it's also
helped us take advantage of new trends
in the software industry where we don't
have to develop all the same expertise
in-house we can really Leverage The the
power that AWS provides one of the
things our company is noticing is a
shift away from large monolithic systems
into sets of distributed services and it
means that we can interact with these
Services individually in a much simpler
way but it introduces complexity around
the edges how do the services
communicate with one another how do they
make sure that the data they're sending
between them is correct and formatted
properly and how do they collaborate and
cooperate to deliver an end-to-end user
experience AWS helps myself for a
company be more flexible we can do so
many more things with the services that
AWS provides that we could ever do on
our own
